origin.li: Shunpei Sato and Shigehiko Urawa of Genetics Section, National Salmon Resources Center Sapporo, Japan
Shogo Moriya and Osamu Suzuki of Research and Development Center, Nisshinbo Industries, Inc., Chiba, Japan
Tomonori Azumaya of Hokkaido National Fisheries Research Institute, Fisheries Research Agency, Kushiro, Japan
Syuiti Abe of Division of Marine Biosciences, Graduate School of Fisheries Sciences, Hokkaido University, Hokadate, Japan
Akihisa Urano of Field Science Center for Northern Biosphere, Hokkaido University, Sapporo, Japan

citeinfo.title: Genetic Stock Identification of Chum Salmon in the Central Bering Sea and adjacent North Pacific Ocean by DNA Microarray During the Early Falls of 2002 and 2003

abstract.p: DNA microarray was used for rapid and accurate identification of 30 haplotypes of the mitochondrial (mt) DNA control region of chum salmon to estimate stock composition of mixture fish caught in the central Bering Sea and adjacent North Pacific Ocean during R/V Kaiyo maru cruise in September 2002 and 2003. The mtDNA baseline included 48 populations around the Pacific Rim. A simulation study suggested only three regions (Japan, Russia, and North America) are discriminated using the present mt DNA baseline, while some haplotypes are useful for stock identification of individual fish. The estimated stock compositions of mixtures are different among areas and also among sampling years. The estimates suggested that Asian stocks were dominant at most survey areas of the central Bering Sea (52-58°N, 172°W-172°E). The estimated Russian contributions were higher in 2002 (21-68%) than 2003 (16-50%), and the component of Japanese stock was 15-77% in 2002 and 15-63% in 2003. In the North Pacific Ocean, the estimated percentage of North American stock was 72-75% in 165°W line but only 7-23% in waters west of 180°. Further baseline data of other variable DNA regions as well as mtDNA control region should be accumulated for more fine-scale stock identification.

[Reference: Sato, S., S. Moriya, T. Azumaya, O. Suzuki, S. Urawa, S. Abe, and A. Urano. 2004. Genetic stock identification of chum salmon in the central Bering Sea and adjacent North Pacific Ocean by DNA microarray during the early falls of 2002 and 2003. (NPAFC Doc. 793) 21 p. National Salmon Resources Center, Toyohira-ku, Sapporo 062-0922, Japan.]

descript.purpose: To report age and stock composition estimates of immature chinook salmon in the western Bering Sea and northwestern North Pacific Ocean.
